articles.headline: Boehner and Obama Nearing Deal on Cuts and Taxes
articles.snippet: Officials said that President Obama and the House speaker, John A. Boehner, were closing in on a package calling for as much as $3 trillion in savings.
articles.abstract: Officials said that President Obama and the House speaker, John A. Boehner, were closing in on a package calling for as much as $3 trillion in savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama and the Republican House speaker, John A. Boehner, once again struggled against resistance from their respective parties on Thursday as they tried to shape a sweeping deficit-reduction agreement that could avert a government default in less than two weeks.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Jackie Calmes

articles.headline: Ex-Executives Dispute Testimony of Murdoch Son
articles.snippet: Two former executives of News International said they told James Murdoch of evidence in 2008 that hacking at the company’s tabloid newspaper was more widespread.
articles.abstract: Two former executives of News International said they told James Murdoch of evidence in 2008 that hacking at the company’s tabloid newspaper was more widespread.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Two former News International executives publicly contradicted James Murdoch’s testimony to a parliamentary committee, saying Thursday that they told him of evidence in 2008 that suggested that phone hacking at one of the company’s tabloid newspapers was more widespread.
articles.byline: By Jo Becker and Don Van Natta Jr

articles.headline: Government Sells Stake In Chrysler
articles.snippet: The sale, which gives Fiat majority control, leaves taxpayers $1.3 billion short of recovering the $12.5 billion lent to the company as it slid into bankruptcy protection.
articles.abstract: The sale, which gives Fiat majority control, leaves taxpayers $1.3 billion short of recovering the $12.5 billion lent to the company as it slid into bankruptcy protection.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The federal government on Thursday shed the last of its stake in Chrysler, giving majority control of the carmaker to Fiat, the Italian company, while leaving taxpayers $1.3 billion short of recovering the full investment they made two years ago to keep Chrysler from going out of business.

articles.headline: Many Seek to Revamp Post Office
articles.snippet: Five bills have been introduced in Congress to revamp the Postal Service, which Democrats and Republicans agree is on the brink of insolvency.
articles.abstract: Five bills have been introduced in Congress to revamp the Postal Service, which Democrats and Republicans agree is on the brink of insolvency.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Until the deficit negotiations took center stage this summer, several members of Congress had another issue they wanted to focus on: an overhaul of the Postal Service, which is on the brink of insolvency.

articles.headline: Lawsuits and Intrigue Over 3M Diagnostic Test
articles.snippet: A suit over a test to be marketed by 3M has escalated into a legal morass ensnaring 3M’s chief executive, Britain’s secretary of defense and a Washington lawyer.
articles.abstract: A suit over a test to be marketed by 3M has escalated into a legal morass ensnaring 3M’s chief executive, Britain’s secretary of defense and a Washington lawyer.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is a legal scrap with tabloid sensibilities: extortion charges, libel claims, British royalty — and a prominent American protagonist, the 3M Corporation, purveyor of staples like Scotch tape and Post-it notes.

articles.headline: Farm Thieves Target Grapes, and Even Bees
articles.snippet: With strong harvests, and reduced crime-fighting budgets, thefts of farm products have risen in California’s rural areas.
articles.abstract: With strong harvests, and reduced crime-fighting budgets, thefts of farm products have risen in California’s rural areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Sgt. Walt Reed said he could tell right away that the grapes were stolen. They looked like an ordinary bunch. Except, he said, for the way they were dressed.

articles.headline: After a Deal, Only More Challenges
articles.snippet: So far so good was Wall Street’s reaction to Europe’s latest effort to relieve Greece’s debt burden, but the plan’s effect on the markets in the coming days was unclear.
articles.abstract: So far so good was Wall Street’s reaction to Europe’s latest effort to relieve Greece’s debt burden, but the plan’s effect on the markets in the coming days was unclear.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by  Louise Story,   Eric Dash and  Julie Creswell
articles.byline: By Louise Story, Eric Dash and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: To Preserve Its Currency Union, Europe Needs a Financial Union
articles.snippet: European leaders now accept that the Continent has a responsibility not just to prevent collapse but to get the Greek economy moving again.
articles.abstract: European leaders now accept that the Continent has a responsibility not just to prevent collapse but to get the Greek economy moving again.
articles.lead_paragraph: If there was one lesson to be learned from the European sovereign debt crisis, it was that monetary union by itself cannot work indefinitely. If Europe really wants to preserve the advantages of the euro currency, it will need far more fiscal and economic integration. Nations will have to give up a significant amount of sovereignty.

articles.headline: At Least 80 Dead in Norway Shooting
articles.snippet: A gunman stalked youths at an island summer camp for young members of the governing party after explosions in Oslo hit government buildings. The police seized a man officials described as a right-wing extremist in connection with both attacks.
articles.abstract: A gunman stalked youths at an island summer camp for young members of the governing party after explosions in Oslo hit government buildings. The police seized a man officials described as a right-wing extremist in connection with both attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: OSLO — A lone political extremist bombed the government center here on Friday, killing 7 people, the police said, before heading to an island summer camp for young members of the governing Labor Party and killing at least 80 people.
articles.byline: By Elisa Mala and J. David Goodman

articles.headline: Debt Ceiling Talks Collapse as Boehner Walks Out
articles.snippet: The epic clash between the White House and Congressional Republicans came just a week before the government hits its borrowing ceiling, and set off sharp accusations from both sides.
articles.abstract: The epic clash between the White House and Congressional Republicans came just a week before the government hits its borrowing ceiling, and set off sharp accusations from both sides.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Negotiations over a broad deficit reduction plan collapsed in acrimony on Friday after Speaker John A. Boehner suddenly broke off talks with President Obama, raising the risk of an economy-shaking default.
articles.byline: By Jackie Calmes and Carl Hulse
